National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1346 CONNECTICUT AVENUE
WASHINGTON 6. D. C.
WILLIAM G. HARLEY
PRESIDENT
April 13, 1965
Miss Marion E. Corwell
Associate Dir. of School Relations
Office of School Relations
Dearborn Public Schools
5757 Neckel
Dearborn, Michigan
Dear Miss Corwell: ' ^-4 ' ' Â£ h.
The next Newsletter will contain a list of NAEB Committees, and I wanted
to let you know why the Public Relations Committee is no longer listed.
There is no doubt that the NAEB needs a well developed PR program, but
this should really be a staff function. I believe you will agree that
a sound Public Relations program cannot be conducted by a committee. If
certain specific matters seem to need committee advice and assistance
(e.g. the present work being done by you and Lee Campion on a speakers
guide), either ad hoc committees or one or two individuals will be asked
to help out.
I appreciate the very real service this committee has provided in the
face of extreme administrative difficulties, and you may be sure that
I will call upon you again.
Sincerely,
William G. Harley
